properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 6:42AM PST until January 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Elko NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and snow expected. Total snow accumulations of
1 to 4 inches expected below 5500 feet with 6 to 10 inches in
locations above 5500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph
creating blowing snow mainly in higher elevations.

* WHERE...Humboldt County.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Tuesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you
must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your
vehicle in case of an emergency.

A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads
and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY
